Reviews.Title: “Good location, but rooms look nicer online than in reality”
Reviews.Author: bjorn4email
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel but there were a few minus points; we had a window towards the street and there was a lot of noise during the night from people on their way home from the bars in the neighbourhood. The bed was also only 140 wide and 190 long which was on the small side for me and my wife, even though we were told this is standard bed size at hotels in Paris. The room in itself was also more basic in reality than what it looked like online.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and size”
Reviews.Author: RosannVermont
Reviews.Content: this is truly a find in the 6th........walking over to the Louvre, Notre Dame, etc. is close.....and St. Germain is a block or two away. The staff was so helpful and friendly....the room was comfortable with the period furniture. Great restaurants a half a block of away. would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “little gem”
Reviews.Author: nyctrichick
Reviews.Content: my husband and i spent 3 nights at this wonderful little hotel on a friend's recommendation. the hotel is perfect depending on how you adjust your expectations. the major plus of the hotel is the location, it could not have been more centrally located, as many others have noted below, right in the heart of st germaine, within short walking distance of many sights and attractions and just a few blocks from several metro stops. our room itself was small and basic, but very clean and nicely appointed, and we managed just fine with quite a bit of luggage (as we'd been traveling for weeks before paris). the staff were warm, helpful and friendly, and the hotel offers a charming lounge and lobby area. i would just mention that there is no fridge in the room (though guests have easy access to hotel fridge in the lobby) and there is no kettle for tea/coffee in the room. the hotel offers tea/coffee upon request but there is a charge of 7 euro. wifi is also slow and spotty. this notwithstanding, so long as you are prepared for these minor inconveniences, the hotel is otherwise overall great!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Charming Left Bank Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Go_Ask_Eddie
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for over a week. We found the property very well situated for exploring the city on foot or by Metro. The busy intersection of St Germaine and St Michele is close yet the hotel is on a quiet old street just down from the Rue de Bucci shopping. Everything you need is at hand. Plenty of cafes and bakeries near. Also a grocery. Several Metro stops and the RER are within an easy walk. The staff were charming and helpful. Our room was clean and nicely furnished and offered free wifi. The only missing amenity that might make an improvement would be a mini refrigerator. Overall we were very pleased and would stay at Hotel de Seine again on our next trip to Paris. It provides good value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: auntcy1
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this wonderful hotel. This was our second time and enjoyed as much, if not more, than the last. Staff is fantastic and location cannot be beat. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE Hotel de Seine”
Reviews.Author: cwm1962
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de Seine was a vital part of our best ever trip to Paris in fall of 2011. Starting at check in (at least 3 hours early and yet we got a room immediately) and throughout our stay our experience was outstanding in so many ways. Our simple but very clean and nicely appointed room was a perfect place to relax after a long day of enjoying the Paris sights which literally start as you walk out of the hotel. The location of Hotel de Seine could not be more perfect as Rue de Seine between Rue de Buci and Boulevard St. Germain is virtually pedestrian only and easily as authentically charming as Rue Cler or other Paris market streets. The Bar du Marche is a few steps up Rue de Seine and this is a true neighborhood cafe where by the third day of our visit the waiters knew what we wanted for breakfast and the food and cafe were delicious. The Louvre. Ille de Citi and Jarden du Luxembourg are just 10 minutes walk away from the the hotel and Plas de St. Germain is 3 blocks away, so this location really cannot be more ideal. Hotel de Seine's incredibly kind, personable and efficient staff added greatly to our stay and we cannot say enough about how welcome Aubrey and her coworkers made us feel. The efficiency that I mention came into play when we decided to extend our stay and Aubrey was able to find us two room nights when most of the hotels in St. Germain were overbooked. On one of our last nights Audrey encouraged us to attend a concert at Saint Chapelle and she was able to get us front row seats to an incredible performance by a baroque chamber orchestra and operatic singer that was one of the highlights of our trip. I can safely say that we will stay at the Hotel de Seine whenever we visit Paris and I cannot recommend this wonderful hotel strongly enough.

Reviews.Title: “will visit again”
Reviews.Author: angie R
Reviews.Content: we had a twin room and it was beautiful. The maids were friendly and did a great job. The front reception were all helpful and friendly and Tristan helped with lots of queries. The location is great and we would stay again. Generally we found the hotels did not provide fridges or coffee facilities in Paris, but overall, this hotel was fantastic. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Agree w/ others: great location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cuteasianjock
Reviews.Content: Especially the night time on duty staff (usually the night staff members are not as attentive at other hotels) Very helpful helping with my reservations/airport shuttle Good size, quiet, clean room for three-star hotel and good size bathroom with a small tub Comfortable bed Rue de Buci, one of my favorite streets, is half a SHORT block away! Would love to stay there again if I can find good rates :)

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: jenac53
Reviews.Content: Nestled cozily in the Saint Germain area of Paris lies this small and charming hotel! Our party of four arrived in the evening in late March 2011 amidst the magic of Paris' night lit splendor. Check-in was simple as our hosts all spoke perfect English and we were thrilled with our amazing find until we discovered that the hotel was under renovation and we had not been notified. We climbed the spiral staircase which was dappled with signs of "wet paint" and taped brown paper. Our room was clean and very adequate. We were on the street side and awoke to the sounds of Paris waking up (which did not bother us at all). Since we walked all over Paris, Hotel de Seine was the perfect starting and ending spot. After a long day of touring our hosts were quite OK with us spreading out a little picnic of bread, cheese and wine in the lovely breakfast room of the hotel. We would totally return to this lovely place (and would love to see it "post renovation"). The only reason I am not giving it 4 stars is because we were not warned (or compensated;) for the impending renovation...would have been nice, just saying...

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely little hotel. Just what we wanted - traditional and cozy. The Staff was unbelieveble helpful!”
Reviews.Author: LizFach
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. perfect for walking, shopping, and eating. Felt perfectly safe too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: irsc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel de Seine for 8 nights in August 2011. Originally booked 4 nights but decided to stay another 4, given all that was happening in London (which was my next destination). The hotel staff is great, always wiling to help. All of them speak very good English, so communication is not a problem. Location is absolutely fantastic; you are within a stone's through distance from a multitude of great cafés, restaurants and galleries. You are also within a short walking distance from the Seine, with the Louvre Museum right across the nearest bridge!! A couple of minor disappointments: * The free wifi kept crashing and I had to ask the staff at least four times to reboot their router. Also, at least twice it would not work at all. The hotel needs to understand that if they promise internet connecting it simply MUST WORK. There are people relying on it for work and/or personal reasons. * I was allocated to a "double room" with street view. The room was located on the top floor and it was more like an attic than a room. I could manage it ok, but a couple (which is what a double room is supposed to have room for) would struggle to coordinate movement inside the room, given with the awkward-shaped ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Amit_Coral
Reviews.Content: We arrived before check-in time and they were really nice and welcomed us. The hotel location just perfect!!! - cafes, restaurants, Patisserie's, a supermarket and metro station just below the hotel. Quiet room clean and cozy, with antique-style furnishings. Waiting to go back there again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic with great staff”
Reviews.Author: canary8
Reviews.Content: This is not what I expected. Basic room, but very clean and servicable. Renovations being carried out around us which had not been previously advised. However, the staff were great, very helpful, and frankly, make the best coffee in Paris. Guess the value for money was not there.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected, but....”
Reviews.Author: JeffreyAC
Reviews.Content: We were two couples on vacation. The location is terrific and very convenient to most attractions. Initially we were disappointed as the hotel is very, very basic. Major disappointment was that they were undergoing renovations and we were not informed. If you want a luxurious room, this is the wrong hotel. The staff was very helpful and given the limited time we spent in our rooms and considering the cost, this hotel worked out just fine for our needs. Having PAUL just down the street for breakfast was terrific and we also made great use of hte markets near by. Streets are very active in the evening and a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: tristan118
Reviews.Content: The room have nothing special. But the hotel is (really) very well located. The staff has been very helpful. That's not the best hotel in the world but conversely, we did not find any reason to complain. For this price, hotels in Paris are often disappointing, this one is not.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again, although I would definitly stay in this area.”
Reviews.Author: Finoula
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on here and thought this hotel looked rather nice. I mailed the hotel for a rate, but they didn't get back to me very quickly so I had to book online - at nearly 30 euros a night more than what the hotel finally offered - so not the best start. However, I was told that my stay there would be 'astounding' and I hoped for the best. Arriving in a thunderstorm late on Saturday night I was shown to what I can only describe as an utterly atrocious room - it stank of cigarette smoke, was tiny and very, very worn. It also overlooked a dark and very unlovely courtyard - the roof outside my window was full of cigarette ends (it's described as a non-smoking hotel). I cried. I felt physically sick. I went straight down to reception and complained (pleaded in fact for another room), but was told I couldn't have another room until the next day, so I couldn't unpack and had to sleep with the window open all night to try to lessen the smell. The man on reception was very kind and helpful - he showed me a new room next morning, which ordinalrily I would have thought ok but rather ordianry, but on this ocassion I thought it was great - it smelled nice for one thing and it overlooked the Rue de Seine and it was a trillion times better than the dump I'd originally been given. I did have a look around at other hotels in the area and most seemed nicer than this one (and when I asked the price most were cheaper than my rate too). Positives - The staff were very pleasant and friendly, the hotel was quiet and my second room was clean. The area is fantastic, great for shopping, sightseeing, mooching, eating and drinking so what more can you ask. Just find another hotel or, if you must book this one, make sure you see a picture of your room first - and don't get stuck with room 12 whatever you do. Audrey on reception knocked 36 euros off my bill, but it wasn't nearly enough for the upset caused - I really shouldn't have had to pay anything for my first night - and it certainly wasn't enough to make me think my stay had been 'outstanding'.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Logofffarms
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel as I lived on the same street many years ago, and knew the location was excellent for sightseeing in Paris. A friend had also stayed there. I was slightly disappointed with the room, as it was pretty basic, with tired decor, and a sad, somewhat saggy, bed. I was hoping for something a bit nicer. And the air conditioner didn't work. Otherwise the room was clean, spacious, and quiet (except when people used the stairs outside our room) and the bathroom was clean and spacious. The staff were excellent. Friendly and very helpful. Which made our stay that much more pleasant. All in all, good value for the money, given it's Paris. If they just updated the beds and the bedding, and fixed the a/c, it would have been perfect. Perhaps my problem is, I am a five-star person on a three-star budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, tiny lift!”
Reviews.Author: emmpeecee
Reviews.Content: This place is just a short walk from the Louvre, and just off the Rue St Germain. You're spoilt for choice with local restaurants for both dinner and breakfast (we didn't eat in the hotel). The room was large, clean, and had a nice old-fashioned feel (in a good way!). The marble bathroom was nice, and the 'proper' old wooden furniture was a nice homely departure from more modern places. The reception staff were very helpful in explaining how to get to places. Oh, and the lift up to the bedroom is tiny! It was a tight squeeze getting two people and two cases in!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for principal sights; hotel manager Audrey? is the perfect daytime hostess to welcome and help you.”
Reviews.Author: retired77777
Reviews.Content: The ambiance and location of the Rue de Seine, (a side street off Blvd St Germain des Pres that connects to the Seine - 5 minutes to Ile de la Cite), is unsurpassed with colorful shops, brasseries, including a butcher, a grocer, fruit and vegetable stand, art shops etc patronized mainly by local residents for a "French" experience. The Metro stop Mabillon is a 5 minute walk, but walking is still the best way from this central location to see the principal sights of Paris. The quiet room had a very comfortable bed, and a clean marble bathroom, - no bidet.however. For le petit dejeuner at my request, they included a 5 minute soft boiled egg.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: madambk1
Reviews.Content: When returning from the South of France, 5 of us needed to spend one night in Paris. I booked two rooms here, one room with two singles, one with three single beds. The hotel is old, but very clean and updated. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly and made us feel welcome. The location is great, an easy walk to attractions and restaurants. The rooms, like most Paris hotels are on the small side, but laid out with enough surfaces for luggage, etc. The hotel was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “A small friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ruthiee02
Reviews.Content: Audrey and her staff were very friendly and helpful to us. They helped us with the city map so we could get to locations easily. The hotel is in walking distance to the Lovre and Seine and other locations and Metro. The room was big enough for 2-3 people and very comfortable. When I return to Paris, I definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: Jasoncraig1970
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Seine has been a 'home away from home' for me, twice a year for the past 13 years - I LOVE IT! I LOVE the location, I LOVE Saint Germain and I LOVE my walk over the river Seine to the right bank for work every day - in the middle of Summer and Winter!!! The staff are always friendly, helpful and always greet me warmly. The hotel is very comfortable/cosy and has that French charm/decoration that you expect from a property like this - it's definitely not modern! It's great value for money. The only thing that I wish they had was a minibar in the rooms - but that's the only negative I can think of. I'll be back in January 2011. Jason - Melbourne - Australia

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION MAKES THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: GLeacy
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed at this hotel and picked it because of location. It is an average hotel with not many amenities but fine for our purposes - just to sleep. The staff was very nice except for the female receptionist during the daytime, who was very rude. The petite de juniere was okay except for the tin of applesauce that was suppose to be the fruit. Have stayed at another hotel nearby several times but decided on a change. Will go back to the other hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “VERY comfortable and pleasant-quiet street right next to many cafes, shops & sites.”
Reviews.Author: Trixie29
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 7 nights here. Couldn't be happier with the size and comfort of our two rooms. We never had a single problem over 8 days. Staff was always very nice. (Have stayed at the Hotel Meurice, etc. before - but wanted a more moderately priced hotel this stay with our young teen children.) The location made it - 5 mins walking to the metro or to the Pont des Arts to cross to the Louvre, 10 mins to Notre Dame. With all the cafes and shops nearby here in the 6th, we stayed out walking the streets past midnight most nights. Happy we had a quiet, nice,comfortable place to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: b00per
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Seine has all the qualities you want in a midrange Parisian hotel. It's in the heart of St Germain, surrounded by charming streets, galleries, restaurants and just a few minutes' walk from the river. Staff are lovely, rooms are basic and neat, good continental breakfast and wi-fi is available. Stay here and soak up the ambiance of the quartier. It's something special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelerDude
Reviews.Content: My second visit to Hotel de Seine in two years, both for business. Brought my wife and 14 yr old daughter over when finished with business. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is the best - three blocks from the Seine and close to Louvre, Notre Dame and several sights. The neighborhood is great, sidewalk cafes in abundance. If you want to immerse yourself in Paris, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveler63
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is ideal. Rooms are reasonable size for Paris for price. Very clean and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mmsitges
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is wonderful, their English is excellent. We are repeat guests and will continue to return. We travel with our 6 year old son, the triple room is a good size for us. The location to the subway, is excellent, the neighborhood is exciting and has wonderful cafes and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A small, cosy hotel with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Travellingdave0
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel de Seine many times over the past couple of years. I am always greeted warmly, I can always rely on a clean, comfortable, and quiet room, and the staff are always eager and ready to deal with any needs I have. The hotel is charming, and small, which creates the advantage of personal service and recognition. It's also superbly situated in the heart of the bustling 6eme, a lively, fun, and fashionable part of town. There's a tremendous choice of bars and restaurants nearby, and often street entertainers to create added buzz and fun to the area.

Reviews.Title: “I was deceived and billed for three nights having stayed two”
Reviews.Author: Juan010BuenosAires
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the hotel and was billed for three. I made a reservation at the hotel for the nights of June 12-13-14. On June 11th I had the concierge at the Hotel Francois 1er ( I do not speak French) phone the hotel and enquire if I could arrive on the 13th at no extra cost since I wanted to spend an extra day in La Rochelle. The concierge confirmed to me that she had phoned the and that I could arrive on the 13th and I would not be charged for the night of the 12th. On that basis I stayed an extra day at La Rochelle. When I arrived at the hotel on the 13th I enquired on this matter and was again assured I would not be billed for the 12th. To my surprise when I checked out I was billed for three nights and I loudly protested to no avail. With respect to the hotel itself its only merit is that it is well located if you want to be in the noisy district of the left bank. breakfast is poor and late an is charged separately. The rooms are tight and not very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fab front of house staff”
Reviews.Author: LaraMark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Seine for one night in May 2010. The hotel is in a great spot with loads of cafe and bars within easy distance, although quite buzzy once you are inside the hotel it's nice and quiet. The hotel reception staff were very friendly and laid back, allowing us to view the remaining available rooms so we could choose which one we wanted to stay in. The receptionist also gave us a great recommendation for dinner on the Saturday night - if you get the chance go to Roger la Grenoille (Roger the Frog!) in Rue des Grands Augustins. It was very enjoyable and busy and not too pricey. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel although it is available we preferred to hit the local cafes and sit in the sunshine watching the world go by. A great short stay at Hotel de Seine, thanks very much.

Reviews.Title: “Really an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: ChiChiinEurope
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this very reasonably priced hotel for 4 nights as we transitioned from living in France to returning to the US. The rooms are elegant and beautifully done, though they are in an old hotel, so don't expect the huge US size hotel room. The breakfast wasn't really worth the money, so we didn't take it after the first day, but I heartily recommend getting coffee and tea in your room. The convenient location lets you have access to fabulous breakfast just down the street so that isn't a problem. Not to mention the other great restaurants, including gelatto and crepes or very french multi course meals. Make sure you take the Paris Walks guided tours in the area, and the helpful hotel staff make great restaurant recommendations and can help you find whatever you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Simply LOVELY”
Reviews.Author: spinach
Reviews.Content: In the middle of it all, yet just a bit away from the evening revelry. You can walk most everywhere in the city. Staff completely accommodating and friendly. Hint: get your pastries at the Carlton, better than Paul's.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chooviss
Reviews.Content: On a trip to Paris in April, I upgraded to this hotel from another (two-star) hotel owned by the same property group. I loved my room at the Hotel de Seine, the bathroom was huge by Paris standards and the hotel staff were friendly, spoke awesome English, and all were very helpful. My room was cleaned daily and was kept very clean, the bathroom has a hairdryer and the little elevator is convenient especially when you have luggage. WiFi access is available in the room, I think it was 5 or 6 Euros per day and the connection was good. This area of Paris is so charming and lively -- great restaurants, shopping and markets. I really love this hotel and will happily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: JustJoeNewYork
Reviews.Content: After thorough research on TA and other sites, I rolled the dice and took a chance on this hotel. Everyone and their brother told me the hotels in Paris leaved much to be desired, so maybe my expectations were low...but when I walked into my room and saw how big and clean it was, I couldn't have been happier. My room was on the 5th floor, was plenty big for 1 or 2 people, and had a great big bathroom as well. In the interest of full disclosure, here's the negatives: A little expensive. I probably paid more than I should have for a hotel, but I didn't feel "ripped off" at all, and it was balanced out by the location, which is fantastic. Water problem - they did have a problem with the heater, which only affected 1 shower for me. The staff was very apologetic and nice about it. Decor - there's a lot of pink and general "fruffiness." But I thought it was funny, personally.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peta123
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the middle of it all, then this hotel is a good bet. We loved being in this lively area (St Germain de Pres), amid all the shops, cafes and restaurants and within walking distance of many of the key attractions. However - and here come the negatives... the hotel did seem to be in dire need of a refubishment. The quaint 'antique' look which they are trying to achieve in the hotel doesn't work (other than the main entrance rooms, which are pleasant) and the place just seemed dirty and dated. Our room was on the top (6th) floor and was relatively small and dark and covered in the craziest bright red and yellow fabric that you've ever seen. There were hairs in the clean bed linen and the carpet and bathroom could have done with a good clean! It was also a road facing room and (on a saturday night) very noisy, so if you want a quieter room then ask for one facing into the courtyard. This meant having to sleep with the windows firmly closed - okay in May, but I imagine unbearable in August. The walls seemed pretty thin too and we did hear a lot of comings and goings throughout the night and early morning. Our friends were on the first floor and were right next to the lift shaft and said that the noise of the old lift kept them awake at night unfortunately. Having read the other reviews on here we didn't bother with breakfast in the hotel (11 EUR I think) and instead went across to Paul (6 EUR) and had great breakfasts there - highly recommended. All in all, I would recommend the hotel if you want somewhere very central and with character and are not too bothered about getting luxury or high levels of cleanliness. But our room was 170 EUR per night and this didn't seem like particularly good value for what felt like a very basic experience.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de Seine
HotelInfo.Address: 52, Rue de Seine, 75006 Paris, France
